s1.title: Installation
s1.p: Avalon runs on a variety of platforms that have installed the Java 2 Virtual Machine. The JSSE (Java Secure Sockets Extention) is required for users who want to compile Avalon to use SSL/TLS facilities.

Everything required to run Avalon and develope Avalon based products comes with the distribution. If you wish to help develop Avalon then it is recomended that you obtain the full source tree from CVS or from the nightly builds

s1.title: Compiling
s1.p: Execute the relavent platform specific script (build.[sh|bat]) in the base avalon directory. Place the JSSE jars into the lib/ sub-directory if you wish to compile in TLS/SSL support.
Executing this script will create a dist directory within the Avalon distribution directory. The dist directory will contain the compiled class files packaged into jars.

s1.title: Testing Your Installation
s1.p: As of the present time there is minimal support for Unit Testing and no support for functional testing. This will change in the future pending changes in ant to support such facilities.
